text: Men marry because they are tired women, because they are curious both are disappointed.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Shallow men believe in luck. Strong men believe in cause and effect.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: As I grow older, I pay less attention to what men say. I just watch what they do.
author: Andrew Carnegie

text: Battle is the most magnificent competition in which a human being can indulge. It brings out all that is best it removes all that is base. All men are afraid in battle. The coward is the one who lets his fear overcome his sense of duty. Duty is the essence of manhood.
author: George S. Patton

text: I have no ambition to govern men it is a painful and thankless office.
author: Thomas Jefferson
